Overall, "In Bruges" is a fun and entertaining movie that I would highly recommend.

Based on your preference cues, here are some potential recommendations:

  * Nightcrawler - a thrilling crime drama about Louis Bloom, a con artist desperate for work, who muscles into the world of L.A. crime journalism and blurs the line between observer and participant to become the star of his own story.
  * Grown Ups - a hilarious comedy about five good friends and former teammates who reunite for a Fourth of July holiday weekend and try to make the most out of their time together despite the fact that they are no longer competitive at the same level as before.
  * Inception - a mind-bending science fiction action thriller about Dom Cobb, a skilled thief who specializes in corporate espionage, who is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C. E. O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.
  * Smilla' s Sense of Snow - a heartwarming drama about a 6 y. o. Inuit boy runs off a snowy roof in Copenhagen and dies. Smilla, a half Inuit who lives in the building and knows the boy, looks into it. What makes an acrophobic boy run up on the roof? The clues take her to Greenland.
